title: 111_s4036
content: The text discusses amendments to the Federal Credit Union Act regarding the Stabilization Fund. It includes provisions for additional advances and assessments to make expenditures, with a special premium assessed to insured credit unions. The premium is due within 60 days of assessment. The Board considers potential impact on credit union earnings when assessing amounts. Special premiums may be imposed on insured credit unions if the Stabilization Fund lacks funds for repayments, due within 60 days of assessment. The Stabilization Fund requires insured credit unions to repay assessments as a percentage of insured shares. Failure to pay may result in penalties. Amendments are made to the Equity Ratio and Net Worth Definition under the Federal Credit Union Act. The Federal Credit Union Act is amended to define net worth for insured credit unions, including retained earnings balance and assistance for resolution. The Federal Credit Union Act is amended to include secondary capital accounts for low-income credit unions, which are uninsured and subordinate to all other claims. A study will be conducted by the Comptroller General of the United States on the National Credit Union Administration's supervision of corporate credit unions and prompt corrective action implementation, focusing on reasons for failures since 2008 and evaluating the adequacy of responses. The administration's response to failures of corporate credit unions, including protecting taxpayers, avoiding moral hazard, minimizing resolution costs, and insured credit unions' ability to bear assessments. Evaluate the effectiveness of prompt corrective action by the National Credit Union Administration for both insured and corporate credit unions. Examine the implementation of recommendations by the Inspector General and the adequacy of reasons for not implementing them. The Comptroller General will submit a report to specific committees within a year of the Act's enactment. The Financial Stability Oversight Council will then report on actions taken in response to the recommendations within six months of receiving the initial report. The National Credit Union Administration receives recommendations under section 120 of the Dodd-Frank Act.
